data.job_title: Senior/Staff Software Engineer, iOS, Developer Platform
data.job_description:
Reddit is a community of communities where people can dive into anything through experiences built around their interests, hobbies, and passions. Our mission is to bring community, belonging, and empowerment to everyone in the world. Reddit users submit, vote, and comment on content, stories, and discussions about the topics they care about the most. From pets to parenting, there’s a community for everybody on Reddit and with over 50 million daily active users, it is home to the most open and authentic conversations on the internet. For more information, visit redditinc.com.
This role is for our Developer Platform team. Reddit already has tens of thousands of creative developers building against our simple API, but we want to give them much broader abilities. Through the introduction of apps and plugins, we’re looking to transform members’ experiences and interactions. r/wallstreetbets should have stock tickers, r/photoshopbattles should have an image gallery, and r/nba should have live scores.The Dev Platform team is working on the platform to make this happen, and we’re looking for someone to bring it to iOS and mobile.

What you’ll do:

• Develop a foundational system for 3rd party developers to build cross-platform UI on Reddit.
• Build a delightful developer experience as well as consumption experience.
• Work as part of a small team (<5 people), contributing to a large iOS codebase (100+ engineers).
• Collaborate cross-functionally with design, product, and engineering counterparts
• Be both a mentee and mentor to other iOS developers.

Who we’re looking for:

• Experience in developing platform features for iOS.
• Experience with building UI using modern patterns (e.g. UIKit, Slicekit, SwiftUI, MVVM)
• Track record of working in both small and large iOS orgs
• Basic familiarity with Javascript (bonus: JavascriptCore!)
• Willingness to work on a zero to one product.

Reddit is continuing to grow our teams with the best talent. This role is completely remote friendly and will continue to be for the future.

Benefits:

• Comprehensive Health benefits
• 401k Matching
• Workspace benefits for your home office
• Personal & Professional development funds
• Family Planning Support
• Flexible Vacation & Reddit Global Days Off
• 4+ months paid Parental Leave
• Paid Volunteer time off

#LI-EM1 #LI-Remote

Pay Transparency:

This job posting may span more than one career level.

In addition to base salary, this job is eligible to receive equity in the form of restricted stock units, and depending on the position offered, it may also be eligible to receive a commission. Additionally, Reddit offers a wide range of benefits to U.S.-based employees, including medical, dental, and vision insurance, 401(k) program with employer match, generous time off for vacation, and parental leave. To learn more, please visit https://www.redditinc.com/careers/.

To provide greater transparency to candidates, we share base pay ranges for all US-based job postings regardless of state. We set standard base pay ranges for all roles based on function, level, and country location, benchmarked against similar stage growth companies. Final offer amounts are determined by multiple factors including, skills, depth of work experience and relevant licenses/credentials, and may vary from the amounts listed below.
The base pay range for this position is:
$183,500—$275,300 USD
Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com.

Experience with building UI using modern patterns (e.g
UIKit, Slicekit, SwiftUI, MVVM)
Track record of working in both small and large iOS orgs
Basic familiarity with Javascript (bonus: JavascriptCore!)
Willingness to work on a zero to one product

Brief Description of Sunnova

Sunnova (NYSE: NOVA) is revolutionizing the energy industry as a leading Energy as a Service (EaaS) provider of solar, battery storage, EV charging, and other energy solutions with customers spanning the U.S. and its territories. Founded in 2012, our goal is to provide homeowners, businesses, and communities with a better energy service at a better price – making clean, renewable energy more accessible, reliable, and affordable.

At Sunnova, we believe that our success comes from the diversity and creativity of our people. Our team is made up of forward-thinkers who are passionate about changing the energy industry for the better, and we're looking for like-minded individuals to join us. We encourage our people to push beyond traditional limits and explore new horizons – because only then can we truly transform the world for the better.

If you're excited about being a part of the fastest-growing segment of the energy industry, we want you on our team!

The Mobile Developer II Position

Sunnova Energy is currently searching for a Mobile Developer II to be responsible for building and maintaining Sunnova’s mobile applications. This individual will work with a team of mobile developers that will collaborate closely with leaders, product managers, user experience experts, third party consultants, and other technology colleagues to design and build the next generation of native iOS and Android apps for Sunnova’s customers and dealers.

Mobile Developer II Responsibilities
• Provides technical input throughout the mobile application development lifecycle (proof of concept, design, development, test, deployment, and support)
• Developing new user-facing features using React Native
• Build reusable components for other developers to use
• Work closely with a Designers and translate those designs and wireframes into high-quality code
• Optimizing components for maximum performance across devices
• Support code deliverables with tests and documentation
• Consume REST or GraphQL APIs

Minimum Requirements
• Bachelor's degree, preferably in computer science, software engineering, information systems or business, or equivalent work experience
• Minimum 4+ years of software development experience, of which 2+ must be mobile app development
• Demonstrated knowledge of cross platform tools for mobile app development such as React Native or Xamarin
• Experience with Redux or MobX, React Hooks, and Unit testing using Jest
• Experience with Typescript, CSS, responsive application design
• Experience with agile development
• Experience with Git, continuous deployment and integration, and other modern fundamentals
• Strong analytic and problem-solving abilities
• Ability to thrive in a team/collaborative environment

Preferred Qualifications
• Experience with both iOS and Android development platforms
• Ability to identify opportunities for technical improvements across multiple processes or functional areas, recommend solutions, and advocate for implementation
• Jira/Confluence proficiency
• Familiarity with ORMs like Sequelize or typeORM
• Experience with Python for backend development

Additional Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
• Ability to communicate effectively and persuasively with a variety of internal and external parties
• Ability to identify opportunities for technical improvements in specific processes and recommend solutions

Working Conditions
• Extended periods of time working at computer workstation
• Some overtime required

Location
• Fully Remote

We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

If you are selected for a position, your employment will be contingent upon submission to and successful completion of a post-offer/pre-placement drug test (and medical examination if required by the role) as well as pre-placement verification of the information and qualifications provided during the selection process.

data.job_description:
Front-End Mobile Developer

12+ Months W2 Contract

San Jose or San Francisco, CA Area Preferred (remote currently during COVID)

The Challenge:

Creative Cloud Mobile Engagement is seeking an accomplished front end developer to contribute to an exciting, high profile effort to change the way new users engage with Adobe's creative applications. We are crafting a mobile-first high performance library to drive user engagement across Adobe all Adobe Creative Cloud applications. While executing on this far-reaching strategy we are focusing on using analytics to drive rapid iteration and to continuously deliver measurable impact. This initiative is a phenomenal opportunity to develop shared technology stack serving the flagship applications as well as emerging next generation products.

What are we looking for in an ideal front end engineer? You will be joining a highly performing team of cross-platform, mobile and front end engineers working closely with the internal product teams and data scientists. Your primary role is to craft the React based templates for engagement experiences across Adobe's mobile offering. You have a user-centric, detail oriented attitude, invite constructive debate, naturally strive to be a mentor and always work with bias towards action. Your work will be grounded on the user's engagement, validated in experimentation and pushing the boundaries of integrated growth strategy. Most importantly you enjoy tackling complex problems, have a deep empathy for customers, and drive tangible results in a team oriented culture.

What you'll do:
• Design, implement, test, profile, release, and optimize the highest quality user experiences using HTML, CSS, & JavaScript
• Work closely with your team and our internal clients
• Partner with designers and product managers to provide an outstanding customer experience
• Engage with customers to identify problems, test ideas, and refine workflows
• Invest in your skillset to stay ahead of the latest development, test, and deployment methodologies

What you'll need:
• B.S. in Computer Science
• Experience in modern web development tools and JS frameworks, preferrably ReactJS
• Familiarity with various UI toolkits and interaction models including responsive design
• Understanding of supporting APIs and web services
• Comfortable with the Agile and Lean development process
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills

We’re always looking for talent that believes in having fun. At PENN Entertainment, you’ll get to be a part of an exciting industry, where the days and nights are fast paced. You’ll work with an incredibly diverse set of co-workers driven by their enthusiasm for helping people find and have more fun. You’ll also get to work at a company that cares about your career growth and will help you get the support you need to expand your possibilities.

Click HERE to learn more about our Day 1 Benefits, 401k Program, Company Perks, Career Opportunities, Advancement Programs, Scholarships and more!

The (iOS) Mobile Developer is responsible for the development, testing, and support of the new and existing mobile applications. This role also collaborates with solutions architects and peer developers to ensure quality, efficient deliverables are produced accurately and timely.
• Develops new mobile applications and enhances existing mobile applications to support PENN's marketing strategy and mobile portfolio.
• Actively observes mobile trends and can discuss with leadership advancement of the mobile portfolio based on those emerging technologies and trends.
• Partners with technical leads to ensure new services align to roadmaps and to understand the impact on the organization’s information architecture.
• Capable of observing a system, understanding it, and making recommendations for improvement.
• Participates in all phases of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including design, coding, code review, testing, bug tracking, change management, deployment, and support.
• Participates in project planning, scoping and estimating. Actively participates in Agile ceremonies.
• Responsible for verifying and understanding conformity to regulatory compliance information. Reports all compliance issues to leadership.
• Maintains strict confidentiality in all departmental and company matters.
• Responsible for ensuring the compliance with all regulatory compliance within area of responsibility and reporting potential issues to Executive Management.
• Bachelor’s degree (B.A./B.S.) in a computer-related field from a four-year college or university; or 2-6 years of experience with the development of Native and/or Hybrid mobile applications; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
• Must have participated in at least one mobile application launch to both Android and iOS Stores.
• Experience with Python, php, Kotlin, or working on a hybrid app highly preferred.
• Must be proficient in Microsoft Applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Power Point).
• Must have technical proficiency in Swift/Objective-C and JavaScript/Typescript.
• Must have functional understanding of Java.
• Must have strong technical skills.
• Ability to adapt to changes in prioritization or schedules of items in the work queue as necessary.
• Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, while meeting deadlines and being proactive when working on tasks.
• Must have knowledge and experience implementing mobile applications with best practices, proven design patterns, and build automation including automated testing.
• Must have strong problem solving, organizational, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills (verbal and written).
• Must have excellent project and time management skills with the ability to multi-task and prioritize.
• Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.
• Must have the ability to interact with guests, staff and colleagues and resolve problems and conflicts in a diplomatic and tactful manner.
• Strong client interface and presentation skills highly preferred.

We’ve grown to become the most innovative omnichannel provider of entertainment experiences, thanks to our 12 retail brands representing 43 destinations across North America, online gaming via Barstool Sportsbook and theScore |BET.

Being an industry leader means more than being a purveyor of fun. We are also committed to values like diversity and sustainability — for our community, our team members, our vendors, and our planet.

We're changing entertainment. Follow us.

data.job_description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic medicines. Our 115,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

About Abbott

Abbott is a global healthcare leader, creating breakthrough science to improve people’s health. We’re always looking towards the future, anticipating changes in medical science and technology.

Working at Abbott

At Abbott, you can do work that matters, grow, and learn, care for yourself and family, be your true self and live a full life. You’ll also have access to:

· Career development with an international company where you can grow the career you dream of.

· Free medical coverage for employees* via the Health Investment Plan (HIP) PPO

· An excellent retirement savings plan with high employer contribution

· Tuition reimbursement, the Freedom 2 Save student debt program and FreeU education benefit - an affordable and convenient path to getting a bachelor’s degree.

· A company recognized as a great place to work in dozens of countries around the world and named one of the most admired companies in the world by Fortune.

· A company that is recognized as one of the best big companies to work for as well as a best place to work for diversity, working mothers, female executives, and scientists.

#software #React ative #iOS #Android #Swift #Kotlin

The Opportunity

You will work with a modern tech stack on mobile and cloud platform that strives to improve the health and well-being of users in over 49 countries. The core platform consists of systems housed in a large-scale environment responsible for processing billions of tasks every day. The candidate should have strong leadership ability and bring a passion for software engineering to help shape the direction of the team. Highly sought-after qualities include versatility and a desire to continuously learn, improve, and empower other team members. Candidate will support building scalable, highly available, efficient, and secure software solutions for medical devices.

What You’ll Work On
• Architect, design and implement Software Solutions for Mobile platforms
• Focused on Mobile platform using React-Native
• Support software development and architecture best practices across multiple projects
• Design and implement services and components for supported architectures
• Support Mobile Development and Architecture using Hybrid Technologies (React Native, Kotlin Multiplatform Mobile) as well as Native Technologies (Swift, Kotlin)
• Architect, design and implement the cybersecurity of the supported systems
• Identify and solve design and technology issues within the current systems.
• Design, Improve and Support product test, build and deployment processed and pipelines.
• Collaborate with internal and external partners to design, develop and integrate with APIs that empower users to share and utilize their medical data in partner systems
• Design and implement unit testable code that is highly maintainable solutions.
• Collaborate with both internal and external team members to shape and define API contracts
• Ensure performance, uptime, and scale, maintaining high standards of code quality and thoughtful design.
• Create software architecture and design documentation for the supported solutions and overall best practices and patterns
• Support solution groups with technical planning, design, and code reviews including peer code review of Pull Request
• Provide Architecture and Technical Knowledge training and support for the solution groups.
• Develop good working relations with the other solution teams and groups, such as Engineering, Marketing, Product, Test, QA.
• Stay current with emerging trends, making recommendations as needed to help the organization innovate.

Required Qualifications
• Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, other relevant field with min 6 plus years' experience or equivalent experience
• Familiar with architectures principles, patterns, framework and blueprints
• Proven experience with architecture and design for mobile, data and/or cloud systems.
• Must have in-depth experience with React Native
• In-depth knowledge of Turbo-Modules, Fabric, Hermes, React Multi-Threading
• Knowledge of React Native applications build process.
• Proved Experience with mobile technologies and languages for iOS and Android: Swift, Kotlin, JNI, C/C++ (on mobile)
• Familiar with data architecture and design practices for mobile solutions
• Familiar with Analytics Products (Firebase, Segment IO etc)
• Preferred experience with CICD Products (AzureDevOps, CircleCI, Harness, Jenkins, Fastlane, Sentry)
• Preferred experience with Deployment Support Products (Microsoft App Center, TestFlight, PlayStore)
• Preferred experience with Development Support Products (Flipper, Crashlytics, Code Analytics)
• Familiar with Cybersecurity best practices and solutions for supported architecture. Familiar with cryptography concepts.
• Preferred experience with application security aspects of obfuscation and code protection.
• Proven experience implementing mobile solutions and components.
• Preferred to have familiarity with multiple operating systems (iOS, Android, MacOS, Linux, Windows)
• Experience with documenting architectural and deign decisions.
• Experience with working and supporting with multiple development team members.
• Ability to work well with a team in a high-performance organization.
• Comfortable working asynchronously with a distributed team.
• Excellent written, verbal and listening communication skills.
• A willingness to learn new software development languages to meet goals and objectives.
• Strong Computer Science fundamentals and experience with software development.
• Eagerness to contribute beyond experience level.

Apply Now
• Participants who complete a short wellness assessment qualify for FREE coverage in our HIP PPO medical plan. Free coverage applies in the next calendar year.

Learn more about our health and wellness benefits, which provide the security to help you and your family live full lives: www.abbottbenefits.com

Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that can help you build your future and live your best life. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.

Connect with us at www.abbott.com , on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

N/A

Company Description

ISAAC partners with North American fleets to provide a user-friendly solution that simplifies trucking. Focused 100% on the trucking industry, we help carriers overcome challenges, while boosting driver happiness. With proven system reliability and system integration capabilities driven by our open platform, our solution helps your drivers and back-office team work smoothly. For more information, visit www.isaacinstruments.com.

Let's work together to help create the technological future of the trucking industry! We're expanding our in-house team and look forward to meeting people driven by the same passion for innovation

Job Description

ISAAC Instruments, a fast-growing company, is seeking a Mobile Application Developer to join its R & D team.

As a mobile Application Developer, you will participate in the design and coding of mobile apps under the Xamarin platform.

Responsibilities
• Developing mobile applications based on defined requirements
• Assisting in all aspects of mobile app development
• Participating in development meetings and applying Agile and Scrum best practices
• Participating in the maintenance of existing applications
• Delivering high-quality code
• Testing and documenting the features developed
• Conducting code reviews

• Experience using REST type services
• Good knowledge of C# and Xamarin
• Development experience on Android
• Knowledge of MVVM pattern, dependency injection and event stream processing
• Ability to learn new technologies quickly
• Performance driven
• Ability to adapt and work in existing applications
• Good understanding of multitier architecture

Assets
• Good knowledge of Android UX development (AXML)
• Knowledge of MVVM Light or MVVMCross libraries
• Knowledge of SQLite or of any other mobile apps database

Additional Information

Collaborators are at the center of ISAAC’s interests and values. This explains the numerous benefits of working at ISAAC, namely:
• varied career opportunities
• a stimulating work environment focused on innovation
• enthusiastic and collaborative teams
• competitive salaries and benefits promoting work-life balance: a complete group insurance plan, group RRSP, an EAP, flexible hours, 4 weeks of vacation, etc
• various social activities and free snacks every day

Position Summary...

What you'll do...
Walmart Corporate
Bentonville, AR

The Health Horizontal Infrastructure team is looking for a Sr. Software Engineer to focus on Automated Testing and Tooling. You will have experience in Java, Spring Boot, DevOps, CICD, Automated Testing, and Large-Scale Systems. You will focus on improving the testing and processes within the team. As we move toward a DevOps heavy process and organizational structure, proper testing and tools are important for us to achieve true CICD.

About NewBETs Health and Wellness:
Our team is focused on developing a streamlined company that includes service operations and technology solutions for Finance, People, and Associate Digital Experience (ADE). We also provide a variety of services such as procurement, supplier portfolio management, merchandising master data, and analytics. From developing HR chatbots and virtual assistants to creating invoice solutions and facilitating legal changes, we help guide efficiency across Walmart globally. Walmart Global Tech's NewBETs Health and Wellness Data organization is a driving force behind our technology strategy across the Pharmacy, Vision, Omnichannel, and Digital lines of business in healthcare. We are working to bring empirical data into every conversation and to create common system infrastructures to consolidate system designs and create efficiencies around data-centric processes. We are a progressive technology group working in an Agile environment that is looking for technologists who want to solve complex, high-scale business problems. We are looking for leader with a technical background, experience leading engineers, and strong ownership.

What you'll do:

Lead medium- to large-scale projects by reviewing project requirements, translating requirements into technical solutions, gathering requested information, writing, and developing code, conducting unit testing. Communicating status and issues to team members and partners.
• Work in a Java service environment building tools to create efficiencies in automation testing.
• Create team technology and process standards.
• Write automated tests to ensure error-free code and performance. All technical members of the team write automated tests, but you will lead the direction and strategy for that work.
• Either individually or leading a team of resources, determines hardware/software systems requirements and leads systems hardware/software design. Analyze, designs, programs, debugs, support, and modify software enhancements and new products used in local, networked, or Internet-related computer programs.
• Complete documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. May work with users to define system requirements or necessary modifications.

What you'll bring:
• 6 plus years of software development with automated testing and DevOps Experience.
• Knowledge in deployment automation tools (Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Nomad, etc.)
• Knowledge in Distributed Systems and the challenges that come with them
• Knowledge of testing technologies, patterns, and strategies.
• Java language skills
• Experience with testing frameworks (JUnit, Cucumber, Karate, or similar) and concepts (CHO, Integration, Unit, etc. )
• Experience with Behavior-driven Development (BDD)
• Experience Designing, Scoping, and Building large projects

About Global Tech

Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That's what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We're a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world's leading retailer who make an epic impact and lead the next retail change. People are why we improve, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered.

We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity and those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new experience for virtually every industry, or use your expertise to change at scale millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Flexible, hybrid work

We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily virtual, while remaining near the locations Global Tech calls home. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team, be more flexible in our personal lives and spend less time commuting. Of course, being together in person is an important part of our culture and shared success. We use our campuses to collaborate and be together in person, as business needs require and for development and networking opportunities.

Benefits & Perks:

Beyond a great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

data.job_description:
Redfin is revolutionizing the $75 billion real estate industry. We use data, beautiful software, and innovative design to put customers first at every step in the home-buying and selling process. Get ready to dive headfirst into our award-winning mobile apps, solving complex problems in a highly visible, customer-centric way. If you value doing great work in a collaborative environment, join our team! As a Senior Android Mobile Developer on the Consumer Apps engineering team, you'll join a passionate team working to enable Redfin's app developers to build and ship the top-rated real estate apps. We support the infrastructure to ensure our app is fast and stable. We also build the core frameworks, mobile design system, and tooling to support building features for our customers that allow them to interact with the home buying experience while on the move. The Role Design and implement complex, technical projects that enable Redfin's app developers to build and ship the top-rated real estate apps. Contribute to the long-term strategy of the Android platform, considering technical and product-level concerns. Collaborate with your teammates by reviewing code, writing documentation, refining best practices, and building maintainable and testable codebases. Work closely with our product and design teams to understand user and business needs. Drive the team forward in Android best practices and design principles, bringing in cutting-edge industry trends. Who You Are You continually obsess over improving the user experience, whether it's collaborating with product managers and designers to build beautiful products or finding and squashing performance bottlenecks. You have 5
years of development experience with at least 3 years of Android experience. You have practical experience building Android applications in Kotlin and Java, and a solid understanding of computer science and engineering fundamentals. Effective communication:
you can collaborate across distances and experience levels, and you can disagree constructively with respect for everyone's opinions and ideas. You stay on top of what's happening in the Android community and are always looking for ways to improve the products you make. data.job_description:
Senior Oracle EBS Developer

Who We Are:

Founded in 1985, Telamon is a family-owned, minority-owned, and privately held company based in Indiana with global operations. Our vision is to be a load bearing support across generations, and we live by our core values of Honesty, Harmony, Simplicity, and Stewardship. We are deeply committed to honoring transparency, championing diversity, and cultivating growth. We talk about these often, and this is an important part of who we are!

What We Do:

Telamon leads the pack in designing, building, and installing telecommunication networks enabling connectivity in all forms, from traditional mobile phone usage and connectivity in stadiums, hospitals and schools, all the way down to connected safety in our cars with the industrial manufacturing of wire harnesses for airbag and seatbelt applications. We have a diversified business model that cultivates growth not only for our company but for our employees as well.

What We Need:

We are currently seeking a Senior Oracle EBS Developer to join our team! If you are looking for a place to grow your skills and share our values, read below and see if this role is a match for you.

The Oracle EBS senior developer will serve as a facilitator between IT and the business by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment of tasks related to technical solutions that leverage systems, software, and related features that benefit the business internally and externally. Tasks include Implement technical and functional Oracle EBS solutions across the full project lifecycle, design and develop technical solutions that meet business requirements based on functional designs, perform problem analysis, debugging and coding as part of new development, support system upgrades, patches, testing, develop reporting and alerting requirements, develop relationships and partnerships internally and externally to optimize business processes, document and maintain system processes, report and resolve technical issues and recommend improvements, communicate insights and findings to the business for corrective action, and be an ambassador for positive change and process discovery that provides value to the business.

Classification: exempt/salaried

Location: If local, 50% in Carmel office, 50% remote. If not local, 100% remote. Candidates in California, Colorado and New York City are not being considered for this role.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
• Under minimal direction, formulate and define system scope and objectives to develop or modify moderate to complex technology systems
• Responsible for designing and implementing cost-effective solutions to meet business requirements within time parameters and operating performance standards
• Develop business scope, requirements, functional, technical, unit test, integration test, and deployment documentation of business processes across multiple applications
• Work on SDLC lifecycle and multiple methodologies like waterfall and agile
• Resolve software issues/ bugs in an application and also resolve integration issues across multiple applications.
• Work on configuration, extensions, modifications, localizations, and integrations (CEMLI) of ERP software
• Work on patch and upgrade analysis on application processes which includes functional and technical aspects of applications and resolve possible system issues related to those upgrades
• Implement functional setups related to Oracle EBS modules, Oracle APEX, and Salesforce
• Develop conversions, customizations, and integration of ERP applications and applications around it
• Work on business scope, requirement, technical, functional, deployment, project cutoff documentation (MD50, MD70, MD12) related to application.
• Utilize programming languages including SQL, PL/SQL, Java, JavaScripting, C, C++, JSON, HTML, CSS, and Unix Scripting and frameworks like Oracle application framework, Springs, and Application development framework.
• Leverage multiple tools including Oracle Forms, Reports, Workflows, JDeveloper, TOAD, SQL Developer, Oracle APEX, XML Publisher, Eclipse, BI Publisher, SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Server Intelligence Services, Hyperion, SQL*Loader, and PVCS
• Work on projects related to multiple Oracle modules including General Ledger, Payables, Receivables, SubLedger Accounting, Order Management, Purchasing, Project Accounting, Inventory. Work in Process, Bills of Material, Advance Supply Chain Planning, Production Scheduling, Human Resources, Time and Labor, and Payroll
• Work on Fusion HCM Applications and OTBI reporting and integration across Fusion application
• Work on multiple operating system platforms including Unix, Linux, and Windows
• Act as a mentor toward other Oracle EBS Developers.

Essential Functions:
• System Maintenance (8% of time): Assist in the review, testing and implementation of System upgrades or patches. Collaborate with functional team to coordinate application of upgrade or fix. Maintain tables. Document process and results.
• Production Support (35% of time): Perform problem analysis, debugging and code fix as part of production support to fix bugs. Provide support in researching and resolving problems, unexpected results or process flaws; recommending solutions or alternate methods to fix production issues.
• Application Development (45% of time): Recommend process/customer service improvements, innovative solutions and/or major variations from established policy that must be approved by appropriate leadership prior to implementation. Use project management skills in managing projects and provide overall project management experience for a given IT initiative.
• Training (7% of time): Develop user procedures, guidelines and documentation. Train clients on new processes/functionality. Train new system users.
• Individual Development (5% of time): Maintain awareness of current system trends with a focus on product and service development, delivery and support, and applying key technologies. Examine trends in information systems training, materials and techniques. Through classes, reading, CBTs or other mechanisms, continuously increase both knowledge and application/tools knowledge. Participate in user group meetings/conferences.

Managerial Responsibility
• This position does not manage any other workers.

Travel/Shift Requirements
• This position may require minimum travel.

Physical Demands
• The position requires sitting, standing and possibly some light lifting, less than 20 pounds.

Skills and Abilities Required:
• Business process knowledge and experience in R12, primarily in order management, inventory, receiving, and shipping
• Proven ability in warehouse operational efficiency projects; WMS (Warehouse Management System) skills/experience highly preferred
• Experience in the development of all aspects of RICE objects
• Experience in Design and Development of Workflows and AME
• Experience in design and development of complex Oracle Forms and Reports
• Strong SQL, PL/SQL, OAF skills including performance tuning
• Experience developing reports in BI Publisher and Oracle Report Builder
• Experience with Unix/Linux Shell scripts
• Familiarity with Oracle suggested standards and approach for delivering EBS work products
• Ability to interpret and write technical publications/diagrams, and project specifications
• Ability to multi-task several projects
• Experience in various phases of implementation life cycle: Prepare, Design, Build, Test, Deploy
• Proven experience effectively prioritizing workload to meet deadlines and work objectives
• Knowledge and experience generating process documentation
• Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills

Education and Experience Required:
• Bachelor's degree
• Minimum of 5 years' Oracle development experience, specializing in order management, inventory, receiving, shipping
• WMS (Warehouse Management System) experience highly preferred
• Oracle Certification preferred
• Telamon Corporation is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment. Telamon does not and will not discriminate against any applicant because of race, color, religion, age, national origin, disability, sex (including sexual orientation and gender identity), marital status, veteran or military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Telamon Corporation makes all employment decisions in a non-discriminatory manner.

There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly, and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?

We believe that inclusion propels innovation and is the foundation of all that we do. United's Digital Technology team spans the globe and is made up of diverse individuals all working together with innovative technology to build the best airline in the history of aviation. Our team designs, develops and maintains massively scaling technology solutions brought to life with innovative architectures, data analytics, and digital solutions.

Key Responsibilities:

Mobile is the future. If you're interested in a career that involves using the latest Mobile and most modern technologies, please look no further. United is seeking dedicated and motivated Mobile developers to be a part of their teams in Houston, TX. The Mobile Developer will partner with the eCommerce team and IT to develop, program, and test various projects dealing with the latest Mobile technologies. In the evolving Digital eCommerce space, new Mobile technologies appear in the market at a frequent pace. This changing landscape requires a versatile team that is in touch with the market, passionate about new technology, while at the same time able to understand the needs of our customers and how emerging technology can improve the customer experience.

The Client:

Intelletec is partnered with an AI creative lab that focuses on enabling creativity through generative audio and video. They have an impressive track record of producing music videos for renowned artists such as Linkin Park, Kid Cudi, and Mike Shinoda. They also develop user-friendly products for musicians, artists, and creatives. The company is artist-driven, bootstrapped, and profitable, with a significant subscriber base and numerous signups since their launch in January. Their diverse team comprises creative, open-minded, and entrepreneurial individuals from various backgrounds. Working with our client means engaging with a wide range of customers and clients, including independent artists, animators, and established creatives from around the globe.

The Role:

Our client wants to add a world-class Mobile Developer who will drive the mobile front-end development, taking full ownership of their iOS and/or Android platforms. As a key player in their small team, your measurable objectives will include:
• Successfully leading the launch and continued development of an app on both iOS and Android platforms within the first 90 days.
• Achieving a 4.5+ star rating on both the App Store and Google Play within the first year after launch, indicative of a high-quality, bug-free, user-friendly application.
• Reducing the incidence of critical bugs or software issues related to new code by 30% within the first six months, ensuring a stable and reliable application for our users.

What you’ll do:

As a Mobile Developer, you translate our client's company and customer needs into functional and visually stunning interactive mobile applications. You will work closely with design and product teams to create a unique creation and artistic experience for new and existing users.

Requirements
• You have 3+ years of relevant industry experience in mobile development (iOS and/or Android).
• You can work in the U.S. timezone, though they consider candidates from anywhere.
• You are passionate about elegant mobile development and strongly desire to push the boundaries of technology and art in this new era of AI.
• You live and breathe music and the arts.
• You can work independently and proactively solve problems.
• You are a leader who is passionate about building products and teams.
• You have a remote-first mindset but value in-person meetings or events.

Fing is the #1 network scanner for mobile with more than 50 million downloads across its mobile and desktop apps. Fingbox, the hardware companion of the Fing app, raised $1.7 million on Indiegogo to meet the needs of our wide user base to secure and solve issues with their home networks. Our patented technology is used by top Internet providers and device manufacturers worldwide.

Fing is consolidating into a single platform to help people with their networks across multiple apps, website and appliances.

Working together with the product team, this is a great opportunity to work across the full project lifecycle, involved with all levels of the business that reaches millions of people every month.

At Fing we are building a new way to consider the home network as an integral part of the domestic experience, including network security, consumer-grade troubleshooting and home protection.

Now we are looking for passionate engineers that are self-driven, experienced and eager to continuously learn new technologies. If you are interested in joining an incredibly fun and talented mobile team and get a chance to work with not just software but with hardware as well, we look forward to hearing from you!

Booking

Job Description

At Booking.com, data drives our decisions. Technology is at our core. And innovation is everywhere. But our company is more than datasets, lines of code or A/B tests. We’re the thrill of the first night in a new place. The excitement of the next morning. The friends you make. The journeys you take. The sights you see. And the food you sample. Through our products, partners and people, we can empower everyone to experience the world.

B.responsible

Our guiding principle is that by helping our users we help our business, so we listen to our customers and give them features they want to use. As a developer in our mobile team you'll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small start up-like group which takes full ownership of its part of our platform. You'll be working on the iterative improvements we make as part of our high-speed release cycles, as well as looking ahead and implementing broader changes to our mobile app.

Rethink is on a mission to inspire hope, power, and potential. Founded in 2008 and headquartered in NYC, Rethink First is a pioneer and market leader in behavioral and mental health technology.

Developed by nationally recognized experts in the field, Rethink’s award-winning online solutions feature comprehensive video-based training and education programs and sophisticated behavior intervention planning tools for individuals and caregivers. Rethink’s offerings include individualized assessments, online skills-based activities, access to remote clinician-led consultations and more.

The Rethink First platform is used by Fortune 500 companies, school districts, government agencies, public and private behavioral health providers, and families caring for individuals with developmental disabilities worldwide. At Rethink First you can expect a healthy work life balance with flexible hours, fully remote work with an office based in NYC, and a competitive benefits and comp plan.

We are looking for a Senior iOS Developer responsible for the development and maintenance of applications aimed at a range of iOS devices including mobile phones and tablet computers. The application’s main focus will be around consuming REST APIs, storing and working with data offline, and displaying the data in a user-friendly fashion.

• Design and build applications for the iOS platform
• Ensure the performance, quality, and responsiveness of applications

• Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git

Mobile Developer (REMOTE)

The Mobile Developer (REMOTE) is responsible and committed to the design, development, modification and maintenance of the mobile app and connected systems to support the organization mission and vision. The developer must have the ability to demonstrate and apply creative problem-solving capabilities, sophisticated design while adhering to quality and best design practices. The developer should have the ability to analyze, design, implement and maintain the mobile application and its supporting technologies.

Mobile Developer (REMOTE) Perks:

- 100% Remote

- 4-day work week

- AMAZING, low cost benefits.

- $ for $ match up to 5% on 401k starting on day one

- Great vacation policy in addition to 12 paid holidays

- Opportunity is on a small dev team (about 2 others). Everyone has the opportunity to think outside of the box and bring solutions to the table. They have fun at work, but they get things done. They have realistic expectations and it’s a Scrum environment. A jovial group.

Mobile Developer (REMOTE):
• Ensures that solutions are developed based on best practices as defined by Precept and industry standards.
• Reviews, designs, edits and assures quality control of code changes throughout the SDLC.
• Design, build and implement efficient, reusable and reliable code for the mobile application, API server, and supporting systems.
• Works closely with the product team to improve mobile app design and functionality. Ability to understand and translate application requirements into functional applications.
• Develops APIs to support functionality of mobile devices.
• Implement testing procedures to identify bugs, and ability to improve and resolve bugs.
• An active participant in the technical design and architectural discussions to map technical requirements to end user requirements.
• Enhances, modifies and maintains existing applications with some supervision as directed by senior staff members.
• Familiar with various design and architectural patterns.
• Assists the Technology functional area with other tasks as needed.
• Arrives in a timely fashion to be ready and prepared to begin work at the scheduled time, including breaks and meal periods.
• Begins each workday by joining requisite staff prayer and Bible study, by actively participating and ensuring the same of departmental team members and leaders.

Mobile Developer (REMOTE):

1. A minimum of 3+ years of experience in the software development field, knowledge relating to the area in which analysis and coding is performed.
• 3+ years of experience developing mobile applications.
• Apple and Google Play
• 3+ years of experience and proficient with use of React Native, JavaScript, TypeScript, CSS.
• 3+ years of experience coding against web APIs required (REST, JSON, GraphQL)
• Demonstrated understanding and use of SDLC required.
• 1+ years of experience in Full Stack Development desired.
• Experience with NodeJS, NestJS, PostgreSQL, Sequelize, SQL, Firebase, Contentful, and data structuring desired.
• Proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, while utilizing proper time management skills.
• Proven ability to work well as a team member on cross-functional teams completing tasks in scope and on target.
• Ability to listen, provide solutions, and reconsider positions when needed. Handles the giving and receiving of instruction and criticism with professional tact.
• Strong proofreading, grammar and copywriting skills.
• Highly organized self-starter with a desire to learn new technologies.
